channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Democratic Rep. Katherine Clark discusses GOP megabill heading for Trump's signature
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Rep. Katherine Clark, D-Mass., a member of House Democratic leadership, about Democrats' inability to stop the GOP megabill bound for the president's signature.

item.title: President Trump takes victory lap after Congress passes tax cut and policy bill
item.description: President Trump touted his success in Iowa Thursday night and has a signing planned for his signature tax cut and policy bill on July Fourth.

item.title: States may meet federal deadline on new Colorado River water-sharing deal
item.description: About 40 million people rely on the Colorado River for drinking water. It also irrigates agricultural fields. It's also shrinking. Now, states might agree on a potential deal on sharing the river.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump takes a victory lap after Congress passes GOP megabill, the latest on Russia's war in Ukraine, more immigrants are likely to leave the U.S. than come in this year.

item.title: Two Catholic colleges in Iowa merging to reduce costs, expand offerings
item.description: Some religious colleges and universities in the U.S. are in trouble and are cutting programs. Others are seeking mergers to reduce costs and expand offerings.

item.title: How did Elon Musk's Starlink become so dominant in the market?
item.description: The team from NPR's "Planet Money" looks at Elon Musk's Starlink and its big lead in the satellite internet market. Can it stay ahead of its competitors?

item.title: 'Love Island USA' producers ask fans to stop cyberbullying the show's contestants
item.description: The producers of the dating reality series "Love Island USA" have called on fans to stop cyberbullying contestants on the show. When does fandom cross the line into abuse?

item.title: NYC hotel that became flashpoint in public opinion on immigration closes
item.description: A New York City hotel that became a symbol of the massive wave of immigration under the Biden administration is permanently closing.

item.title: On this July 4th, NPR listeners describe what freedom means to them
item.description: For Independence Day, NPR's "Morning Edition" asked listeners to define freedom.

item.title: Russian airstrikes intensify after Pentagon pauses weapon shipments to Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine scrambled to defend itself from Russia's largest barrage of missiles and airstrikes on Kyiv overnight. Trump says no progress was made to end the war during a call with Russia's Putin.
